text: Billy Leo Williams (born June 15, 1938) is a retired American baseball left fielder. He played sixteen seasons in Major League Baseball (MLB) for the Chicago Cubs and two seasons for the Oakland Athletics. Williams was added into the National Baseball Hall of Fame in 1987.National Baseball Hall of Fame Retrieved May 5, 2015 In 1999, he was named a finalist for the Major League Baseball All-Century Team. ==References== ==Other websites== *BaseballLibrary.com *Baseball Almanac *"Its all about R-e-s-p-e-c-t for 'Sweet Swingin' Billy Williams *The Williams-Santo Cubs 1961-1965 @ The Hardball Times Category:1938 births Category:Living people Category:Chicago Cubs players Category:Oakland Athletics players Category:Sportspeople from Alabama Category:National Baseball Hall of Fame members
title: Billy Williams
